N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 4 §§ 28-3.6 - Return to work

State Regulations

The appointing authority may require an employee who has
been absent because of personal illness charged to donated leave credits, prior
to and as a condition of return to duty, to be examined, at the expense of the
department or agency, by a physician designated by the appointing authority, to
establish that such employee is not disabled from the performance of his/her
normal duties and that the return to duty will not jeopardize the health of
other employees. Notes
